params.text:
This wizard allows you to document how you work on your project in a structured way. 

In order to document your project properly, you should include the following steps: 

  1. Goals
  2. Plan
  3. Project work
  4. Evaluation
  5. Goals assessment

It's important you take notes during your actual project work. You'll make good use of them here.

params.taskDescription: Start by submitting the title of your project:

params.helpText:
By pressing Read more you'll find more information and examples related to each step. 

Navigate between the steps by using the arrows or the left menu. 

When you have completed all the steps, you can save your documentation as a Word document on your device. You can later edit this document, send it to your teacher or print it.

params.description: Add goals for your project work by pressing the button below. You should describe each goal in your own words.
params.helpText:
In this step you define the goals for your project work. 

Press the Add goal button to add a new goal to the list.

You can add as many goals as you like.

goalDeletionConfirmation.message: Are you sure you want to delete this goal?

params.text: In this step you should write down what you are going to do in the project work, how you are going to do it and why.

params.helpText:
Planning is about what to do, how you are going to do it and why you should do it. 

Checklist:

  • What kind of equipment do you need?
  • Who are you going to work with? Will you need help?
  • How long time does it take? Should you create a progress plan?
  • What kind of information do you need and where can you find it?

params.text:
In this step you're going to describe what you did when you were working on the project. Remember to explain the choices you have made.

Here, you will probably need the notes you took during the actual project work.

params.helpText:
In this step you are going to describe how you did the actual project work. 

Checklist: 

  • Did you have to deviate from your plan? In what way and why?
  • Did any unexpected events occur? How did you manage such events? Explain your decisions.

params.text: In this step you are going to evaluate your project work. Were the results of the project work as expected? If no, then why not? What have you learned?

params.helpText:
In this step you should evalate your project work results. Finally you should sum up what you have learned while working on your project. 

Checlist: 

  • What were you satisfied with?
  • What would you have done otherwise?
  • What have you learned?

params.description: In this step you should assess how well you achieved the goals you defined for the project.
params.noGoalsText: You have not chosen any goals yet.
params.helpText:
It's important that you assess your goal achievement at the end of the project. This way, you'll be able to improve and do better next time. 

You will be able to rate each goal you defined in the Golas step into three categories: 

  • Goals you achieved completey
  • Goals you achieved partially
  • Goals you didn't achieve

params.description:
Well done!

On this page you can choose to export all your submitted text, as well as your goals and goal assessments.
params.requiresInputErrorMessage: One or more required input fields need to be filled.
params.helpText: Press the Create document button to preview. From the preview, you can choose to select all your text and copy it, or you can download the text as a Word document.
